Close top ad Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void) ============================== From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm)") , [Hydralisk (Wings of Liberty)](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Wings_of_Liberty) "Hydralisk (Wings of Liberty)") and [Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm Campaign)](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Heart_of_the_Swarm_Campaign) "Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Zerg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/Zerg_race_icon.png/30px-Zerg_race_icon.png%20%22Zerg%22) Hydralisk [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/4/4b/SC2Hydralisk.jpg/600px-SC2Hydralisk.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Hydralisk.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/4/4b/SC2Hydralisk.jpg/600px-SC2Hydralisk.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Hydralisk.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Ranged attacker. Requirements: * [Hydralisk Den](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_Den "Hydralisk Den") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e4/Vespene-zerg.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  50 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/7/7b/Buildtime_zerg.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  24 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/02/Supply-zerg.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  2 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : H Attack 1: Needle Spines Targets: Ground / Air Damage: 12 (+1) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 20.4 (+1.7) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 0.59 [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 5 (+1) Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 90 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Biological](/starcraft2/Biological "Biological") , [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 (+0.98) Speed Multiplier on Creep: 1.30 Speed on Creep: 4.09 (+1.0275) Cargo size: 2 Strong against: * [Banshee](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Banshee (Legacy of the Void)") * [Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mutalisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Void Ray](/starcraft2/Void_Ray_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Void Ray (Legacy of the Void)") Weak against: * [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Siege Tank (Legacy of the Void)") * [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Zergling (Legacy of the Void)") * [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Colossus (Legacy of the Void)") \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Zerg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/Zerg_race_icon.png/30px-Zerg_race_icon.png%20%22Zerg%22) Burrowed Hydralisk [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/7/77/SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg/600px-SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/7/77/SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg/600px-SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2HydraliskBurrowed.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 90 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Biological](/starcraft2/Biological "Biological") , [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Sight: 5 Speed: Immobile Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.2 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.3 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ The **Hydralisk** is a ranged [Lair](/starcraft2/Lair "Lair") \-tech unit that can be morphed after building a [Hydralisk Den](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_Den_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hydralisk Den (Legacy of the Void)") . The Hydralisk's fast attack and high damage, along with not relying on bonuses to specific unit types, makes it consistently effective at dealing damage to both ground and air targets. Can morph into the [Lurker](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") after morphing the Hydralisk Den into a [Lurker Den](/starcraft2/Lurker_Den "Lurker Den") . Due to the large difference in speed off-creep and on-creep, the **Muscular Augments** upgrade and/or spreading creep should be a key focus when executing any Hydra-based strategy. Hydralisks (and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") ) are made for their attack range to counter units with a similar attack range like [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") . Hydralisks are fragile, so they are often paired with high health [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") to tank and [Burrow](/starcraft2/Burrow "Burrow") /[Tunneling Claws](/starcraft2/Tunneling_Claws "Tunneling Claws") combo to retreat the low health Roaches. This simple and forgiving unit composition is great for lower level players that wish to practice their micro with a friend against Terran [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") or Protoss [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") units before moving onto a more complex unit composition. They are the only Zerg ground units that can attack air other than [Queens](/starcraft2/Queens "Queens") . Note that while the Hydralisk also has a melee attack animation when attacking ground units at melee range, this attack is still affected by the normal Ranged Attack upgrades. However, this close range attack is not affected by [Guardian Shield](/starcraft2/Guardian_Shield "Guardian Shield") or the now removed [point Defense Drone](/starcraft2/Point_Defense_Drone_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Point Defense Drone (Legacy of the Void)") . Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Morph to Lurker](/starcraft2/Morph_to_Lurker "Morph to Lurker") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/8e/Morph_to_Lurker.jpg/62px-Morph_to_Lurker.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:Morph_to_Lurker.jpg) | **Caster:** [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk")

**Researched from:** [Hydralisk Den](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_Den "Hydralisk Den")

Increases the attack range of [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk")
by +1. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ * [Nydus Worms](/starcraft2/Nydus_Worm "Nydus Worm") or [Overlord](/starcraft2/Overlord "Overlord") drops are commonly used with **Hydralisks** and [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Queen (Legacy of the Void)") to make up for their lack of mobility to attack one location and using a more mobile units to attack a second location. * Hydralisks are considerably weak against area-of-effect damage without the ranged support of [Broodlords](/starcraft2/Broodlord "Broodlord") , [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , or the high health of [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") to tank damage. [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Baneling (Legacy of the Void)") , [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") /[Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , and [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") all have bonuses againts [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") units in addition to having splash damage. Unsupported Hydralisks will also struggle against Charge-upgraded [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Zealot (Legacy of the Void)") , [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hellion (Legacy of the Void)") , and masses of [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Marine (Legacy of the Void)") . * The Hydralisk is usually the alternative to the [Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") after it has been hard countered by air splash damage of [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") or [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Widow Mine (Legacy of the Void)") or overwhelmed by bonus Light damage of [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Phoenix (Legacy of the Void)") ; after this Zerg can transition to [Nydus Worms](/starcraft2/Nydus_Worm "Nydus Worm") to continue the raiding style of Mutalisks if the opponent does not push an attack. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * Against [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") , **Hydralisks** may be considered one of the best counters to [Gateway](/starcraft2/Gateway "Gateway") units (particularly the problematic [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") ) and the damage they inflict is especially effective against [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") . * Moreover, with enough upgrade spending, Hydralisks can even trade with [Void Rays](/starcraft2/Void_Ray "Void Ray") almost 1 to 1. However, the damage itself is outweighed by the Zerg being attrition-based race, so late game Hydralisks still remain glass cannons - while retaining their effective damage, their health and armor is found lacking when facing a Protoss deathball or lots of AoE. That being said, while Hydralisks' main weakness is their vulnerability to AoE, the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") are severely lacking in that regard. Hence, when in army versus army combat, be on alert for enemy [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") or [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") , and, if you note their presence, stay on the widest ground possible, as their AoE can only work if they can get you trapped in a narrow path (and remember - narrow for [Zerg](/starcraft2/Zerg "Zerg") is not the same as narrow for [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") or [Terran](/starcraft2/Terran "Terran") ). [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") is another threat you have to be cautious about. While seemingly undangerous units when facing a horde of Hydralisks, the combination of [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") and [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") does pose a lot of danger. [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") will wall your Hydras off, while [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") with a [range upgrade](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lance "Extended Thermal Lance") will burn your army down. The relatively obvious solution to the aforementioned is using either a few [Vipers](/starcraft2/Viper "Viper") and their [Abduct](/starcraft2/Abduct "Abduct") or a few [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") with [Neural Parasite](/starcraft2/Neural_Parasite "Neural Parasite") upgrade. Once the target is pulled in, it must be focused down, wherever it's abducted or mind-controlled. Obvious uses for Hydralisks in ZvP include using them as a backbone AA unit (as their burst makes short work of [Carriers' Interceptors](/starcraft2/Interceptor "Interceptor") ), or playing Hydralisk rush, with topping the rush with [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , [Overseers](/starcraft2/Overseer "Overseer") and [Vipers](/starcraft2/Viper "Viper") . Do note, however, that "Golden Armada" of [Carriers](/starcraft2/Carrier "Carrier") is barely stoppable by Hydralisks alone, so you either have to end the [ZvP](/starcraft2/index.php?title=ZvP&action=edit&redlink=1 "ZvP (page does not exist)") game fast or not consider the latter strategy at all. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * With **Grooved Spines,** Hydralisks can outrange unattended [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") and [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") . * Hydralisks are useful as mobile anti-air to shut down aerial harassment threats, such as [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") , loaded [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") , and [Banshees](/starcraft2/Banshee "Banshee") . * They can also protect valuable air units like [Broodlords](/starcraft2/Broodlord "Broodlord") from [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") in a pinch, although [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") are usually preferred for this because of their superior mobility. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Due to the [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") \-focused nature of ZvZ, Hydralisks represent a significant power spike that, when scouted, often requires a response of either extreme aggression or building one's own tech. Hydras are frequently added to a Roach army to form a Roach/Hydra style when there has been early aggression and neither player has maxed-out or gotten close to maximum supply with Roach/[Ravager](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") . Adding even a handful of Hydras to an army that is already nearly maxed makes a noticeable difference in DPS once each army has spread out, as Hydras even without [Grooved Spines](/starcraft2/Grooved_Spines "Grooved Spines") for range can safely fire from behind the Roach line. Hydras also give the player building them access to anti-air, allowing them to clear out [Overlords](/starcraft2/Overlord "Overlord") and [Overseers](/starcraft2/Overseer "Overseer") which will likely be all throughout the map. Some players may add a few Hydras earlier for this purpose to either supply block their opponent or to remove map vision. Because Hydralisks make a smaller benefit when added to a large Roach/Ravager ball without their upgrades and are more fragile, players may start a [Lurker Den](/starcraft2/Lurker_Den "Lurker Den") and Hydra upgrades as soon as the Hydra Den finishes and only make a small group of Hydras a little over halfway through the Lurker Den's build time. This gives the player immediate access to [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") once they hatch. This is a common choice for a player who is behind and looking to defend without adequate defense. While the Hydra upgrades research, such a player may be more aggressive and try to get the jump on their opponent with the added splash damage of the Lurkers. Ravagers' [Corrosive Bile](/starcraft2/Corrosive_Bile "Corrosive Bile") out-ranges an unupgraded Lurker, so special care must be taken maneuvering them. Ideally, after taking cost effective fights, such a player will re-max with a decent number of Hydras alongside their Roaches and Ravagers, their Hydra upgrades nearly complete. In the late game, the ultimate unit composition is Hydra/[Viper](/starcraft2/Viper "Viper") /Lurker, but because these units are so expensive in terms of vespene gas and are fairly fragile, Roaches will often see continued use alongside them. Ravagers' Corrosive Bile out-ranges an unupgraded Lurker and may be used safely before they have the range upgrade, [Seismic Spines](/starcraft2/Seismic_Spines "Seismic Spines") , especially before a player has Vipers for [Blinding Cloud](/starcraft2/Blinding_Cloud "Blinding Cloud") /[Abduct](/starcraft2/Abduct "Abduct") to properly engage them. Ravagers will have a smaller place in the late game as they are so expensive in gas and are out DPS'd by the equal range, less expensive Hydra(upgraded), but their ability is a still a strong zoning tool. A high Hydra count allows for massive DPS and gives the player a chance to jockey for positioning against their opponent's Vipers. Against Lurkers, Hydras and Roaches have similar vitality due to the Lurker's 50% bonus damage to armored units. If facing a player using the [Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") /[Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") /[Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") style, Hydralisks are an important step in a successful defense, but should not be used as a direct answer to the Mutas. Although more cost effective in even numbers at a small count, eventually the Mutas' mobility will allow them to make cost effective hit-and-runs, as well as be able to stack in such great numbers that they have far more units attacking at once and quickly retreat for a fast, full heal. [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") for [Fungal Growth](/starcraft2/Fungal_Growth "Fungal Growth") and a high [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") count (10+) are much more effective at zoning out or potentially catching many of the Mutas. Vipers also are important for landing dangerous [Parasitic Bombs](/starcraft2/Parasitic_Bomb "Parasitic Bomb") , and should be supported by high damage anti-air like Hydras to keep the Viper alive afterwards; Queens' damage is more long-form and might not be enough to stop the Mutas diving on the Viper if it is in an undefended position. Scouting an opponent's Hydra Den may indicate an eventual Lurker transition as opposed to trying to end the game with [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisks "Ultralisks") . Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/4/4f/Hydralisk.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Hydralisk.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * [Hydralisk's sounds (video and sound)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_5WK9cqiic) - YouTube video. Patch Changes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Patch Changes")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.8.0 [\[1\]](#) | | --- | | * “Evolve Muscular Augments” is now split into two separate upgrades:
* "Evolve Muscular Augments" upgrade will increase the Hydralisk base movement speed by 25%.
* Cost 150/150, Research time: 71
* "Evolve Grooved Spines" upgrade will increase the Hydralisk attack range by 2.
* Cost 100/100, Research time: 71
* Changed the Hydralisk movement speed to be affected the same as other units while on Creep.
* Muscular Augments now gives a 25% speed boost both on and off of Creep. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.8.0 Balance Update [\[2\]](#) | | --- | | * "Evolve Grooved Spines" upgrade removed, and +1 range is now added back to "Muscular Augments" upgrade. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 3.11.0 Balance Update [\[3\]](#) | | --- | | * Health increased from 80 to 90. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.1.4 Balance Update [\[4\]](#) | | --- | | * The "Muscular Augments" upgrade has been split into two separate upgrades:
* Muscular Augments
* Upgrade cost is 100 Minerals / 100 Vespene Gas / 71.4 Research time.
* Grooved Spines
* Upgrade cost is 100 Minerals / 100 Vespene Gas / 71.4 Research time. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.2.0 [\[5\]](#) | | --- | | * Hydralisk attacks now have a new green visual effect once Grooved Spines has been researched. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.7.1 [\[6\]](#) | | --- | | * Unburrow speed decreased from 0.71 to 0.36.
* Unburrow random delay decreased from 0.36 to 0.08.
* Needle Spines attack speed changed from 0.54 to 0.59. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 5.0.11 [\[7\]](#) | | --- | | * Muscular Augments move speed bonus off Creep increased from 0.79 to 0.98.
* Damage point reduced from 0.15 to 0.1 (Damage Point is the time it takes for a unit to complete it's attack. Reducing it allows more time for movement in between attacks.) | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 5.0.12 [\[8\]](#) | | --- | | * Speed upgrade research time reduced from 71 to 64 seconds.
* Range upgrade research cost / time reduced from 100/100 / 71 seconds to 75/75 / 50 seconds. | References\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=11 "Edit section: References")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. html:
Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki


This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm), Hydralisk (Wings of Liberty) and Hydralisk (Heart of the Swarm Campaign).
[e][h] Hydralisk

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Abilities
  • 3 Upgrades
  • 4 Competitive Usage

Description[edit]

The Hydralisk is a ranged Lair-tech unit that can be morphed after building a Hydralisk Den. The Hydralisk's fast attack and high damage, along with not relying on bonuses to specific unit types, makes it consistently effective at dealing damage to both ground and air targets. Can morph into the Lurker after morphing the Hydralisk Den into a Lurker Den.

Due to the large difference in speed off-creep and on-creep, the Muscular Augments upgrade and/or spreading creep should be a key focus when executing any Hydra-based strategy.

Hydralisks (and Lurkers) are made for their attack range to counter units with a similar attack range like Stalkers and Marauders. Hydralisks are fragile, so they are often paired with high health Roaches to tank and Burrow/Tunneling Claws combo to retreat the low health Roaches. This simple and forgiving unit composition is great for lower level players that wish to practice their micro with a friend against Terran Barracks or Protoss Gateway units before moving onto a more complex unit composition. They are the only Zerg ground units that can attack air other than Queens.

Note that while the Hydralisk also has a melee attack animation when attacking ground units at melee range, this attack is still affected by the normal Ranged Attack upgrades. However, this close range attack is not affected by Guardian Shield or the now removed point Defense Drone.

75

Competitive Usage[edit]

  • Nydus Worms or Overlord drops are commonly used with Hydralisks and Queens to make up for their lack of mobility to attack one location and using a more mobile units to attack a second location.
  • Hydralisks are considerably weak against area-of-effect damage without the ranged support of Broodlords, Lurkers, or the high health of Roaches to tank damage. Banelings, Hellions/Hellbats, and Colossus all have bonuses againts Light units in addition to having splash damage. Unsupported Hydralisks will also struggle against Charge-upgraded Zealots, Hellions, and masses of Marines.
  • The Hydralisk is usually the alternative to the Mutalisk after it has been hard countered by air splash damage of Liberators or Widow Mines or overwhelmed by bonus Light damage of Phoenix; after this Zerg can transition to Nydus Worms to continue the raiding style of Mutalisks if the opponent does not push an attack.

Vs. Protoss[edit]

  • Against Protoss, Hydralisks may be considered one of the best counters to Gateway units (particularly the problematic Sentry) and the damage they inflict is especially effective against Stalker and Zealots.
  • Moreover, with enough upgrade spending, Hydralisks can even trade with Void Rays almost 1 to 1. However, the damage itself is outweighed by the Zerg being attrition-based race, so late game Hydralisks still remain glass cannons - while retaining their effective damage, their health and armor is found lacking when facing a Protoss deathball or lots of AoE.

That being said, while Hydralisks' main weakness is their vulnerability to AoE, the Protoss are severely lacking in that regard. Hence, when in army versus army combat, be on alert for enemy Disruptors or High Templars, and, if you note their presence, stay on the widest ground possible, as their AoE can only work if they can get you trapped in a narrow path (and remember - narrow for Zerg is not the same as narrow for Protoss or Terran). Colossi is another threat you have to be cautious about. While seemingly undangerous units when facing a horde of Hydralisks, the combination of Colossi and Sentries does pose a lot of danger. Sentries will wall your Hydras off, while Colossi with a range upgrade will burn your army down. The relatively obvious solution to the aforementioned is using either a few Vipers and their Abduct or a few Infestors with Neural Parasite upgrade. Once the target is pulled in, it must be focused down, wherever it's abducted or mind-controlled.

Obvious uses for Hydralisks in ZvP include using them as a backbone AA unit (as their burst makes short work of Carriers' Interceptors), or playing Hydralisk rush, with topping the rush with Lurkers, Overseers and Vipers. Do note, however, that "Golden Armada" of Carriers is barely stoppable by Hydralisks alone, so you either have to end the ZvP game fast or not consider the latter strategy at all.

Vs. Terran[edit]

  • With Grooved Spines, Hydralisks can outrange unattended Widow Mines and Marines.
  • Hydralisks are useful as mobile anti-air to shut down aerial harassment threats, such as Liberators, loaded Medivacs, and Banshees.
  • They can also protect valuable air units like Broodlords from Vikings in a pinch, although Corruptors are usually preferred for this because of their superior mobility.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

Due to the Roach-focused nature of ZvZ, Hydralisks represent a significant power spike that, when scouted, often requires a response of either extreme aggression or building one's own tech.

Hydras are frequently added to a Roach army to form a Roach/Hydra style when there has been early aggression and neither player has maxed-out or gotten close to maximum supply with Roach/Ravager. Adding even a handful of Hydras to an army that is already nearly maxed makes a noticeable difference in DPS once each army has spread out, as Hydras even without Grooved Spines for range can safely fire from behind the Roach line. Hydras also give the player building them access to anti-air, allowing them to clear out Overlords and Overseers which will likely be all throughout the map. Some players may add a few Hydras earlier for this purpose to either supply block their opponent or to remove map vision.

Because Hydralisks make a smaller benefit when added to a large Roach/Ravager ball without their upgrades and are more fragile, players may start a Lurker Den and Hydra upgrades as soon as the Hydra Den finishes and only make a small group of Hydras a little over halfway through the Lurker Den's build time. This gives the player immediate access to Lurkers once they hatch. This is a common choice for a player who is behind and looking to defend without adequate defense. While the Hydra upgrades research, such a player may be more aggressive and try to get the jump on their opponent with the added splash damage of the Lurkers. Ravagers' Corrosive Bile out-ranges an unupgraded Lurker, so special care must be taken maneuvering them. Ideally, after taking cost effective fights, such a player will re-max with a decent number of Hydras alongside their Roaches and Ravagers, their Hydra upgrades nearly complete.

In the late game, the ultimate unit composition is Hydra/Viper/Lurker, but because these units are so expensive in terms of vespene gas and are fairly fragile, Roaches will often see continued use alongside them. Ravagers' Corrosive Bile out-ranges an unupgraded Lurker and may be used safely before they have the range upgrade, Seismic Spines, especially before a player has Vipers for Blinding Cloud/Abduct to properly engage them. Ravagers will have a smaller place in the late game as they are so expensive in gas and are out DPS'd by the equal range, less expensive Hydra(upgraded), but their ability is a still a strong zoning tool. A high Hydra count allows for massive DPS and gives the player a chance to jockey for positioning against their opponent's Vipers. Against Lurkers, Hydras and Roaches have similar vitality due to the Lurker's 50% bonus damage to armored units.

If facing a player using the Mutalisk/Zergling/Baneling style, Hydralisks are an important step in a successful defense, but should not be used as a direct answer to the Mutas. Although more cost effective in even numbers at a small count, eventually the Mutas' mobility will allow them to make cost effective hit-and-runs, as well as be able to stack in such great numbers that they have far more units attacking at once and quickly retreat for a fast, full heal. Infestors for Fungal Growth and a high Queen count (10+) are much more effective at zoning out or potentially catching many of the Mutas. Vipers also are important for landing dangerous Parasitic Bombs, and should be supported by high damage anti-air like Hydras to keep the Viper alive afterwards; Queens' damage is more long-form and might not be enough to stop the Mutas diving on the Viper if it is in an undefended position. Scouting an opponent's Hydra Den may indicate an eventual Lurker transition as opposed to trying to end the game with Ultralisks.

Patch Changes[edit]

[hide][show]Patch 3.8.0 [1]
  • “Evolve Muscular Augments” is now split into two separate upgrades:
    • "Evolve Muscular Augments" upgrade will increase the Hydralisk base movement speed by 25%.
      • Cost 150/150, Research time: 71
    • "Evolve Grooved Spines" upgrade will increase the Hydralisk attack range by 2.
      • Cost 100/100, Research time: 71
  • Changed the Hydralisk movement speed to be affected the same as other units while on Creep.
  • Muscular Augments now gives a 25% speed boost both on and off of Creep.
[hide][show]Patch 3.8.0 Balance Update [2]
  • "Evolve Grooved Spines" upgrade removed, and +1 range is now added back to "Muscular Augments" upgrade.
[hide][show]Patch 3.11.0 Balance Update [3]
  • Health increased from 80 to 90.
[hide][show]Patch 4.1.4 Balance Update [4]
  • The "Muscular Augments" upgrade has been split into two separate upgrades:
    • Muscular Augments
      • Upgrade cost is 100 Minerals / 100 Vespene Gas / 71.4 Research time.
    • Grooved Spines
      • Upgrade cost is 100 Minerals / 100 Vespene Gas / 71.4 Research time.
[hide][show]Patch 4.2.0 [5]
  • Hydralisk attacks now have a new green visual effect once Grooved Spines has been researched.
[hide][show]Patch 4.7.1 [6]
  • Unburrow speed decreased from 0.71 to 0.36.
  • Unburrow random delay decreased from 0.36 to 0.08.
  • Needle Spines attack speed changed from 0.54 to 0.59.
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.11 [7]
  • Muscular Augments move speed bonus off Creep increased from 0.79 to 0.98.
  • Damage point reduced from 0.15 to 0.1 (Damage Point is the time it takes for a unit to complete it's attack. Reducing it allows more time for movement in between attacks.)
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.12 [8]
  • Speed upgrade research time reduced from 71 to 64 seconds.
  • Range upgrade research cost / time reduced from 100/100 / 71 seconds to 75/75 / 50 seconds.
